title: 2016 Sun Belt Conference football season
text:
The 2016 Sun Belt Conference football season was the 16th season in which the <a href="Sun%20Belt%20Conference">Sun Belt Conference</a> operated a <a href="American%20football">football</a> league, and was part of the <a href="2016%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20FBS%20football%20season">2016 NCAA Division I FBS football season</a>. The season began on September 1 with <a href="2016%20Appalachian%20State%20Mountaineers%20football%20team">Appalachian State</a> facing <a href="2016%20Tennessee%20Volunteers%20football%20team">Tennessee</a>. This was the third season for the Sun Belt since <a href="2010%E2%80%9313%20Sun%20Belt%20Conference%20realignment">realignment</a> that took effect in <a href="2014%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20FBS%20football%20season">2014</a>, which added the tenth and eleventh members — <a href="Idaho%20Vandals%20football">Idaho</a> and <a href="New%20Mexico%20State%20Aggies%20football">New Mexico State</a>. Both teams were previously <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20FBS%20independent%20schools">independents</a> before joining the conference. The Sun Belt Conference is a <a href="Group%20of%20Five%20conferences">"Group of Five" conference</a> under the <a href="College%20Football%20Playoff">College Football Playoff</a> format along with the <a href="American%20Athletic%20Conference">American Athletic Conference</a>, <a href="Conference%20USA">Conference USA</a>, the <a href="Mid-American%20Conference">Mid-American Conference</a>, and the <a href="Mountain%20West%20Conference">Mountain West Conference</a>.
In this season, the Sun Belt football conference included 11 members: <a href="Appalachian%20State%20Mountaineers%20football">Appalachian State</a>, <a href="Arkansas%20State%20Red%20Wolves%20football">Arkansas State</a>, <a href="Georgia%20Southern%20Eagles%20football">Georgia Southern</a>, <a href="Georgia%20State%20Panthers%20football">Georgia State</a>, <a href="Idaho%20Vandals%20football">Idaho</a>, <a href="Louisiana%E2%80%93Lafayette%20Ragin%27%20Cajuns%20football">Louisiana–Lafayette</a>, <a href="Louisiana%E2%80%93Monroe%20Warhawks%20football">Louisiana–Monroe</a>, <a href="New%20Mexico%20State%20Aggies%20football">New Mexico State</a>, <a href="South%20Alabama%20Jaguars%20football">South Alabama</a>, <a href="Texas%20State%20Bobcats%20football">Texas State</a>, and <a href="Troy%20Trojans%20football">Troy</a>. The conference championship was determined by win-loss record within the conference.
Arkansas State entered the season as defending Sun Belt champions, as they went undefeated in <a href="2015%20Sun%20Belt%20Conference%20football%20season">2015 conference play</a>. The Red Wolves went on to lose to <a href="2015%20Louisiana%20Tech%20Bulldogs%20football%20team">Louisiana Tech</a> in the <a href="2015%20New%20Orleans%20Bowl">New Orleans Bowl</a> 28–47.
Preseason.
2016 predictions.
The 2016 preseason coaches predictions were released on July 21, 2016, with the vote conducted by the head football coaches of each conference school. Appalachian State was picked to win the conference for the first time in school history. After coming second in the conference last year which resulted a trip to the <a href="2015%20Camellia%20Bowl">Camellia Bowl</a>, the Mountaineers returned 22 starters on the field for the upcoming season. Arkansas State, which had won at least a share of the conference title in four of the previous five seasons and was returning 13 starters (6 on offense, 7 on defense), was tapped to finish second.
Below are the results of the coaches poll with total points received next to each school and first-place votes in parentheses.
References:
Season.
For the first time in the 16-year history of Sun Belt football, a team from the conference was ranked in the top 25 of the AP Poll. In Week 11, the <a href="2016%20Troy%20Trojans%20football%20team">Troy Trojans</a>, with a record of 8-1, received the #25 spot in the AP Poll. The Trojans lost their next game, to Arkansas State, to drop back out of the rankings.
